title: League of Legends is still the most popular game in the world
body:
I'm pretty sure if it wasn't fun than people would stop playing. Like I understand that you don't like some specific ideas. There are about 130 champions in league and we complain mostly about like what, 10? If that? That means that over 120 other champions are fun balanced and people enjoy playing or playing against. **27 Million** people play league. I think that more than a couple thousand people would be complaining if something was so wrong that it made the game unplayable. I will repeat that stat.
#27 Million People
That is almost 3 times as many people that live in **New York.** This game is fun and don't you deny it. People play it for a reason. Because it is fun, interesting, and addictive. There are way to many hate threads on these boards. Can't we show Riot some respect? They made an amazing game for us. Maybe if we didn't bitch and moan every time they changed something they might actually listen to us. 

Thanks for listening,
Spammer out.

You're missing a really important element of this. Popularity does not equal quality. 

COD made some pretty cool games, therefore, they became popular, then they ran their brand into the depths of hell. Popularity continued not because of the quality, but because it was a familiar game that everyone's friends were playing. 

WOW was an ingenious MMORPG that was superior in quality than the few other games that were even in the same genre at the time. So WOW became popular. WOW then released several soulless expansions, even going as far as to let players skip the entire game just to get to the end. WOW remained popular because people had invested thousands of hours and had become addicted. It is on it's way out now though. 

League's quality cannot be determined by its popularity, as oftentimes popularity leads to companies believing they can do whatever they want and retain their playerbase. League will most likely fall into the same trap. It was made as a quality alternative to dota, and did a darn good job and was a heck of a lot of fun. So they became popular. Now everyone has invested thousands of hours and have all their friends playing the game, but honestly, the game is not nearly as fun as it once was. Riot has also gone the way of believing they can make any changes they desire and retain their playerbase. 

Really the only question is how long league will remain a quality game, because its popularity will continue long after it loses its soul and becomes crap.

I'm okay with most of what Riot's done.

What I'm not okay with is them completely changing the way SR plays in a way that makes objectives less important. Its so easy to get towers now that they aren't really all that meaningful anymore. 

Dragon doesn't really matter much anymore. 

Baron isn't as important as its been in the past. If you win a teamfights, you can usually just take out an inhibitor or their nexus instead of taking Baron. Because of that, its a throw option more than ever now.

But can you say that you actually don't enjoy playing anymore? I don't care about the details. This game is very fun and there is nothing else to say. They are coming out with new unique champions that are really fun to play, they do every little thing here and there for us. I don't understand why everyone seems to think that Riot is the enemy. They are our friends. We should ask them in a respectful manner, giving good points and not being passive aggressive or straight out aggressive. Dragon is becoming a permanent Baron Buff in theme now, which isn't interesting either.

For me it means that dragon 4 is a win condition and I like that. Too many people were just ignoring dragon or taking it as an afterthought but now it is an objective worth fighting over (in theory). The pace of the game sped up which meant that dragon 5 was rarely relevant but dragon 4 is much more obtainable.

I do agree though the way they buffed dragon is a little... silly?... can't think of the right word for it but I would have liked to see them just drop 4th dragon buff and move dragon 5 up to dragon 4 instead of just giving away easy tower dives. But I guess I will have to see how it plays out in practice.
